title: Derby’s Take: Federal Reserve Officials Continue Brushing Off Market Volatility
sub_head: Monetary policy isn’t driving asset values, Fed Chairman Jerome Powell says
body:
Federal Reserve officials have said over the past few days they don’t believe recent market upheavals will force them to pare the central bank’s aggressive support for the U.S. economy, even as some of them debate what is driving the financial volatility.
Officials who have spoken on the matter are on the same page regarding the Fed’s near zero short-term interest rate stance paired with the central bank’s buying $120 billion a month in bonds, seeing both as necessary to help the economy navigate and recover from the coronavirus...
